このページではCookieが本サイトでどのように使われているかをご説明します。お客様が当サイトの閲覧を続けることで、Cookieの使用に同意したものと見なされます。

Cookieとは

Cookie（クッキー）は、お客様が閲覧中のサイトの要請によりお客様のブラウザ（Internet Explorer やFirefoxなど）によってお客様のコンピューターに保存される小さなファイルです。これにより、お客様が閲覧中のサイトは環境設定や利用履歴などのお客様情報を記憶したり、ログイン状態を保持したりすることができます。

Cookieの保存期間は短期間（ブラウザが開いている間だけ、というように）の場合もありますし、長期間の場合もあります。数年間保存するCookieもあります。本サイトによって設定されたものではないCookieに当社がアクセスすることはできません。

本社のCookie利用方法

本サイトはCookieを以下の様に様々な目的に使用しています。

  • お客様の環境設定の登録と維持。ログイン状態の保持やご要望の言語や表示の保持もこれに含まれます。
  • アナリティクス。これにより、当社はユーザーが本サイトをどのように利用しているかを理解することができ、本サイトの向上に役立てることができます。
  • 広告Cookie（第三者による場合もあり）。本サイトが広告を表示する場合、Cookieは広告などを閲覧したのは誰かをリサーチする目的で広告主によって設定されている場合があります。この場合のCookieは第三者によって設定されている場合があり、本サイトはそのCookieの読み込みや書き込みをすることはできません。
  • その他の、Facebookやツイッター共有といった目的の第三者によるCookie。これらのCookieは通常それぞれ第三者が設定したもので、本サイトがそれらのCookieにアクセスすることはできません。

Cookieの削除/無効化

お客様のCookieやCookie環境設定の管理はご利用のブラウザのオプションや環境設定から行ってください。以下は一般的によく利用されている各ブラウザのCookie管理方法の一覧です。

  • Internet Explorer
  • Firefox
  • Chrome
  • Safari
  • Opera

public static function matchCallback($url, $matchedId, array $site, $siteId)

Akismet is a service that scans comments and determines if they are spam. If you enter an Akismet API key here, user messages will be checked for spam. You can sign up for an API key via their site. If Akismet determines a message is spam, it will have to be manually approved before being displayed.
User alerts will disappear from the alerts list this many days after being viewed. Unviewed alerts do not expire.
Controls how many alerts are shown on each page of users' full alert list.

The maximum width and height of generated attachment thumbnails.

Enable this option to have the system attempt to automatically embed media from URLs posted by visitors that point to registered media sites. If you choose to include a link to the content as well, the media embedding may be duplicated when the message is quoted.

Choose what type of data you want to retrieve from the user.

Note: No scopes are required to let users simply login (which is addon only does). However if another addon decides to use the user token generated by this addon, and want to access specific features of a user's profiles, then please choose any scopes you feel appropriate.
The secret that corresponds to your Battle.net Application Key. It is located in your Application Settings for this specific domain.
Remove data from BB code cache (days)
Cached BB code data will be maintained for this many days. Use 0 to cache all data indefinitely.
This should be set to the current time whenever the available (parsable) BB codes are changed.
Enter a description for your board. This will be placed inside the meta description tag for the forum home page, so avoid using HTML.
When the board is inactive / closed, this message will be shown to site visitors. You may use HTML.
The title of your board. This will be displayed at the top of pages and used in emails.
The primary URL to your board. Do not include a trailing "/" or "index.php". The URL should look similar to this: http://www.example.com/forum

If an email cannot be delivered, the bounce notification will be returned to this email address. If left blank, bounced messages will be returned to the default email address. A value is required here if automated bounce handling is to be enabled. Note that this option may not work unless the return path parameter is enabled or mail is sent via SMTP using the Email Transport option.
If enabled, BB code processing output will be cached. This can speed up display of some pages at the cost of using extra space in the database.
CAPTCHAs help prevent spammers from registering or posting.

When enabled, clicking on a link to a category will take you to a dedicated page that only shows the children of that category. When disabled, users will be redirected to the full forum list and scrolled to the correct category.
This character will be repeated for each character in a censored word that does not otherwise have a replacement specified. For example, if "dog" is censored, it may be replaced with "***".

This is a list of words or phrases that are to be censored. If a replacement word or phrase is entered, the censored text will be rewritten to this (for example, replacing "dog" with "cat"). If no replacement is entered, the censored text will be replaced with censor characters (for example, "***").

If you wish to match a wildcard at the beginning or end of the matched word, add a "*" in the correct position. For example, "dog" will not censor "dogs" but "dog*" will.
Email address where board-related messages will be sent.
Sender info in From header on contact emails

If enabled, emails sent via the "Contact Us" form will be sent with the sender's info in the "From" header rather than the "Reply-To" header. Enabling this may help with situations where replying to a contact message does not go to the correct address, but it may not be compatible with all SMTP servers.

This is the URL to the page where users will be able to contact you. Please note that the overlay option will only work with XenForo URLs, so if you specify an external URL, it most likely will not work with an overlay.
Hours to Retain Read Conversations in Popup
The conversations popup will show all conversations with unread replies, plus any read conversations whose most recent replies fall within the time frame (in hours) before now.
This is the default email address that emails will be sent from.
When developing on a local server, the speed of responses can be too fast for debugging. Adding a value here will delay POST responses by the number of seconds you specify.
Enter the words or phrases that are disallowed in custom user titles. All censored words are automatically disallowed. Place each word or phrase on separate lines.
You may present discouraged users with a blank page from time to time. Enter the percentage chance of this happening.
Discouraged users will be subjected to a page loading delay of a random period between the two values provided here.
The standard minimum time between messages can be multiplied to make discouraged users wait longer between posting. Enter a multiplier here.
Enter the percentage chance that discouraged users will find the news feed disabled when they attempt to use it.
Enter the percentage chance that a discouraged user will be redirected to the redirection page.
You may randomly redirect discouraged users to a different page. Leave this blank to redirect to the forum home page.
When discouraged users attempt to search, this option defines the percentage chance that they will find it disabled. (0 = never, 100 = always)
The number of characters that will be used to create the discussion/thread preview when hovering over the title. Use 0 to disable the preview.
The maximum number of characters of content to include in RSS feeds. Note that this includes any BB code mark up used in the message. 0 will disable content from being included in RSS feeds.
This controls the maximum number of discussions (such as threads) that will be shown on one page.

Enable edit history tracking and prune after X days:

If enabled, moderators will be able to see historical versions of messages and compare changes between them. Historical data will be pruned after the specified number of days. Use 0 to keep the history forever.
Enable edit log display after X minutes:
If enabled, any edit after the delay will cause a "last edited" message to be displayed at the end of the message.

This option allows the "Bounced Email Address" account to be automatically read and processed for bounced email reports. This will detect if emails sent to a user bounce, forcing the user to update their email address and preventing the system from emailing them until this happens. This can help reduce the chance of email sent from your board from being considered spam.

This option will read and remove emails from the specified account when processing. It MUST be directed to an account whose sole purpose is collecting bounce emails from this XenForo installation. A value must be entered for the "Bounced Email Address" option.
Include full message text personal conversation notification emails.

With this option enabled, notification emails sent to conversation recipients will contain the full text of the message about which they are being notified. With this option disabled, they will need to visit the forum to read the message.
If specified, emails sent by XenForo will default to being from this name. If no value is entered, the board name will be used.

If automated bounce processing is enabled, this criteria will be used to determine when multiple soft bounce failures will be considered permanent and emails will no longer be sent to the user.

All threshold values are limited to bounces generated in the last 30 days.
Include full message text in watched thread/forum notification emails.

With this option enabled, notification emails sent to users watching threads/forum will contain the full text of the message about which they are being notified. With this option disabled, they will need to visit the forum to read the message.

This enables the use of INSERT DELAYED SQL queries for elements such as view tracking to increase performance. We only recommend disabling this if your host complains about "long MySQL connections" due to a misconception of what those connections represent.
If enabled, people will be able to browse an alphabetical list of users. This can have performance implications with a large number of users.
With this option disabled, viewing the news feed will be completely disabled.
If you don't use the notices system, you can completely disable it and save a query on session creation.
With this option disabled, the search engine will not function.
Enable variable bounced email address values

If enabled, sent emails will include the recipient email address in the bounce address field. This enables more accurate and more secure automated bounce email handling. If using automated bounce processing, enabling this option is strongly recommended.

This option requires that the specified bounce account is a catch-all account or supports a "+" as a wildcard separator (such as in Gmail). For example, if this option is enabled with a bounce address of bounce@example.com, the email might be returned to bounce+123abc+user=domain.com@example.com.
This option will print more detailed messages about error messages received during the authentication process.

When enabled, all services selected that a user can login with will be condensed into a single button.
This allows for a much more clean look.

This will include every provider in the 'More External Services' button.

When selected, all providers selected in the option 'Minimal List' will appear outline the 'More External Services' button.

All providers selected will appear under a button called 'More External Services', with unselected providers appearing directly on the login bar.

The order is based around your settings for the provider order.

You can change the order and which providers are included (note that if a provider's API key/secret is not in use, it won't appear by default).

When debug mode is enabled, you can add additional providers and modify existing ones.
This option can't be edited manually. It is edited only via the "captcha" option.
Use the boxes here to enter the Facebook User IDs of any users you would like to be able to administer Liked pages.
This field is not required if you have provided an application ID.
The ID that is associated with your Facebook application for this domain.
The secret for the Facebook application you created for this domain.
Change the text shown on Facebook Like / Recommend buttons.

If this feature is enabled, a Facebook 'Like' or 'Recommend' button will be displayed on various pages including the thread view page, allowing Facebook users to 'Like' the page and in doing so, share it with their Facebook friends.

This feature does not require the Facebook application ID or application secret fields to be completed.
Users will have to wait this many seconds between posting messages. Users with the permission "Can Bypass Flood Check" will be exempt from this option.

This controls the maximum number of new profile posts to display on the forum list page. Use 0 to disable this display.
The URL specified here will be used to give information (such as a map) about a physical location. The URL must include a {location} token.

If enabled, your users may source their avatars from Gravatar. When a new user registers, XenForo will automatically search for a Gravatar associated with their email address. If disabled, this will not remove Gravatars from users that already have them.
Settings for integrating the online gaming service Steam as an authentication source and information source for XenForo Forums.

Contains various options relating to the Admin Control Panel itself.
When events happen that affect individual users, they are alerted via this system. As large volumes of alerts are generated, they are periodically pruned from the database.

The 'Discourager' is a system that aims to make the browsing experience of 'discouraged' users as frustrating as possible, with the goal of having them give up and leave.

You may set a user into 'discouraged' mode by editing their user profile, or discourage an IP address or IP address range.
Messages are contained within a discussion container, and options relating to these can be found here.
Various options for adjusting how external providers are viewed.
These options control the integration of Facebook features into XenForo.
Controls integration with various Google services.
Option group IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.
Controls integration with Microsoft Live services.
Options that control what data is logged and how long it is maintained.
Options for configuring and displaying the Donation Manager.
Options here control messages posted by users to the system, including messages in threads, profile posts, personal conversations etc.

The news feed, or activity stream is a constantly-updated log of things that your registered members do, which can be viewed back by other visitors.

It is possible to filter the news feed down to just users you follow, or a single user.
The node and forum list is the primary navigational structure for XenForo's forums and pages.
Options here allow you to turn off or tweak systems in order to fine-tune the performance of your site.
These options control the behavior of the search system built-in to XenForo to allow searching of messages and other content.
You may tweak various link-building and content display options here.
For some functions, XenForo will hand off to a third party service provider. You may change some of the defaults used here.
These options allow you to control how the XML sitemap is generated and submitted to search engines. The sitemap can be used to speed up search engine indexing of your site.
Default options for the Spam Cleaner and Prevention systems are located here.
Controls to manage integration of XenForo with Twitter
In order to maximise your 'signal to noise' ratio when displaying threads to guests, you may hide your members' signatures.
All dates and times will be displayed to guests in this time zone.
This is the URL to your home page, outside of the board. If this is left blank, 'Home' will not appear in the navigation.
Option IDs must be unique. The specified ID is already in use.

If a value greater than 0 is entered, images cached by the image proxy will be refreshed after this many days have passed. This can be used in conjunction with a long cache lifetime to allow images to be updated periodically while retaining resilience against the image being removed. If a value of 0 is entered, images will only be updated when the cache entry expires.

Enter the number of days that proxied images should be retained for, before they are removed from your system. If the image is re-requested after this time, it will automatically be fetched again. Use 0 to retain the images indefinitely.
XenForo can make use of various different image processing libraries to produce image thumbnails etc. Select your preferred library from the list above.
Image and Link Proxy Secret Key

If you have enabled the image or link proxy, this secret key will ensure that images and links are only proxied if the requests originated at your forum. If you find that links are being accessed via third-party sites, you can change this secret key to expire these links. All links stored on the forum will be automatically updated to use the new secret key.
Image and Link Proxy Log Length

This option controls the length of time for which the proxy logs will be maintained after the last request made to an image or a link. If an entry is not requested for this amount of time, its data (including first request time and total accesses) will be removed. Image proxy logs will never be removed unless the image data has been removed (Image Cache Lifetime). Use 0 to disable pruning of the logs.

By enabling these options, you may proxy and cache images and links posted in messages through your own server, allowing tracking of clicks etc. Proxying of images is especially important if you are running your site through SSL (HTTPS).
This is the maximum file size for images that are displayed through the image proxy system. An image larger than this will return a placeholder image instead. You may use 0 to disable the limit.
With this disabled, a URL such as /threads/my-thread.128/ would exclude the title and be output as /threads/128/

If you wish to change the default index page of the forums, you may enter the route path here. The route path is the section of the URL to a page after your main forum directory URL, such as forums/ or pages/page-name/. Do not reference a route filter here.
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their Instagram accounts. You can get a client ID via Instagram's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your Instagram client ID.
Specify a URL to be used for requesting more information about an IPv4 address. The URL must include {ip}, which will be replaced with the actual IP address.
Delete IP usage data after X days:
Old IP logs are rarely useful and simply take up space. They can be pruned after a specified amount of time if desired.
Specify a URL to be used for requesting more information about an IPv6 address. The URL must include {ip}, which will be replaced with the actual IP address.
Controls the source of the jQuery core JavaScript library. You may host this yourself (Local) or use one of the recommended CDN sources. All CDN options support HTTPS/SSL.
The Unix time stamp of the last JS update. This can be changed to force a JS recache even if the XF version doesn't change.
If a discussion spans multiple pages, the last few pages are displayed on the discussion list. Set the maximum number of pages to show here. Set the number to 0 to disable this feature.
LightBox Displays All Images on Page

If this option is enabled, the LightBox overlay in which images are loaded will show all attached and hot-linked images from all messages on the current page. If disabled, the LightBox will show only images from the current message.
Entering a key will allow users to login using their LinkedIn accounts. You can get a key via LinkedIn's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your LinkedIn App ID.
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their Live accounts. You can get a client ID via Live's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your Live client ID.
If a user fails to log in 4 or more times in a 15 minute period, this method will be used to prevent brute force attacks.
Link Logo to Home Page URL
If a home URL is provided, select this option to link the main page logo to that URL. If this option is not selected, the logo will always link to the Index Page Route.
Use CAPTCHA for Lost Password Form
To prevent robots flooding your lost password form, you may add CAPTCHA protection to it.
Minimum Time Between Lost Password Requests (seconds)
To prevent flooding, you may require a delay between lost password requests. Enter a length of time in seconds that users must wait.
Maximum Messages to Check for Spam
Users will only have their messages checked as spam until they have successfully posted this many messages. Use 0 to disable all spam checks.
This number reflects the maximum number of search results that will be found, before permissions are taken into account. Setting this too high may cause performance problems.
Maximum User Names in Members Online Now Box

In order to prevent the 'Members Online Now' becoming enormous on a very busy board, you may limit the number of names before a '... and 12 more' link is added to terminate the list. A value of 0 disables the limit.
Limit the number of members to show on each page of the registered member list, and online members list.
If enabled, messages will be edited in an overlay. This has caused problems for a limited number of people, so you can disable this and edit messages using a full page.
Use 0 to allow an unlimited amount of images per message.
The maximum number of characters that can be in a message. This includes BB code. Use 0 to disable the limit.
Use 0 to disable this limit. Disabling the limit or setting it too high is not recommended, as numerous media embeds can cause browser performance problems.

If true, CSS will be run through minify before being served.

Note: The minification process is processor intensive, and you should only enable this option if you have also implemented a caching mechanism in your library/config.php file.
The number of days that moderator log records will be kept for. Use 0 to keep the records permanently.
Enabling this system allows multiple messages across multiple pages to be selected and quoted in a single reply.
Once news feed items for a particular user are fetched and processed, cache them to help performance, rather than re-fetching and re-processing them every time they are viewed.
News Feed Items to Fetch With Each Request

The maximum number of news feed items to fetch when a user views their news feed. Also controls how many will be cached. Higher numbers require more resources both in terms of storage and processing time.
News Feed Message Snippet Maximum Length
When the text of messages is displayed in news feed items, it will be trimmed to the length specified here.
The message to be displayed on the donate page. You may use HTML that is valid within a <p> tag.
Entering an app ID will allow users to login using their Odnoklassniki accounts. You can get an app ID via Odnoklassniki's Application Process
The public key you received in the Odnoklassniki Application Process.
The secret key you received in the Odnoklassniki Application Process.

After a user interacts with the system (by clicking a link etc.) they will be considered 'online'. They will be considered to be offline if they do not interact with the system again within the time specified here.

Enter the email address of any PayPal accounts other than the primary one that may receive payments for user upgrades. This can be useful if the primary account is changed and recurring payments are still coming from the old account, for example. If the old account is not listed as a valid alternative, payments will not be accepted for this account. Enter one account per line.

This is the primary email address on your PayPal account. If this is incorrect, payments may not be processed successfully. Note this must be a PayPal Premier or Business account and IPNs must be enabled. Please see our help.
Google's +1 button feature allows your visitors to recommend pages from your XenForo installation to others.
This will limit the number of choices that can be given as responses to a poll.
Prevent Discouraged IP Addresses from Registering
You may prevent any visitors browsing from discouraged IP addresses from registering new accounts. They will be informed that registration is currently disabled.
If entered, a privacy policy link will be included in the footer.
Node Types to Include in Quick Navigation Menu

When building the quick navigation menu, include the node types specified here. If an allowed node type is a child of an excluded node type, it will not be shown. Note that this does not change the node list on this page.
This is the number of days to maintain read marking data (such as for threads and forums). Data older than this will always be seen as read.
Manually approve registration if user shares IP used by a banned user in last X days:

This option allows the IP address of a new registration to be checked against IPs recently used by banned users. If one or more matches is found, the registration will need to be manually approved by an administrator.
Check IP addresses in DNS block lists when a new user registers to help prevent spam. If the StopForumSpam integration is not enabled, the Tornevall DNSBL will be checked.
In order to keep the registration form short, many preferences are not shown. This option allows you to set the default values for newly registered users.
Use this option to set a minimum number of seconds that a registration must take before being submitted. This can help prevent spam registrations. Use 0 to disable this option.
If a forum is selected here, the report center will be disabled and a thread will be posted whenever content is reported.
If selected, accented and non-Latin characters in a URL will be converted to Latin equivalents if possible.
Save drafts as messages are being composed

If enabled, drafts will be periodically sent to the server and stored to allow users to resume working on their messages later. Disabling this will also disable the automatic checking for new messages when composing a reply.
This is the minimum length of a word that can be searched by the index. With the default search system, this should correspond with the MySQL full text minimum word length (normally 4).
Search for matching users with content search
You may have the system also return users whose user names begin with the searched keywords when searching for content.
This feature enables users to quote snippets of messages by using their browser's text-selection tools.
Show Cookie Notice on First Visit

When a user first views a page (with no XenForo cookies), if enabled, the user will see a notice stating that cookies are used by this site and continued use consents to the cookies. This option is designed to make compliance with EU cookie regulations easier.
If enabled, messages will display an icon if the author is currently online.
How many donations to show in the sidebar top donations section.
How many donors to show in the sidebar top donors section.

If this option is enabled, the sitemap will be rebuilt automatically periodically. If this option is disabled, the sitemap will only be updated when it is rebuilt manually through Tools > Rebuild Caches. The current sitemap can be accessed via sitemap.php.
Automatically submit sitemap to search engines

Once a sitemap is built, if this option is enabled, the updated version will be automatically submitted to search engines. If this option is not enabled, search engines will only know about the sitemap if it is listed in robots.txt or if you manually submit it to them.
If you wish to exclude certain content types from the sitemap, that can be done here. Note that content must be guest accessible to be included in the sitemap, regardless of this setting.

If desired, you may include additional URLs that would not otherwise be included in the sitemap. Place each URL on separate lines. Note that these URLs must match your board URL or they will not be included. Partial URLs will be converted to absolute URLs automatically.
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their SoundCloud accounts. You can get a client ID via SoundCloud's Client Applications
The secret that corresponds to your SoundCloud client ID.
When checking for other users having used the same IP addresses as those logged for a spammer, this control limits the search to the last X days.
These are the default options that will be checked when running the spam cleaner. The individual who actually runs the spam cleaner will have the opportunity to alter these options.

This is the default text for the email that can be sent to users when the spam cleaner is applied against them. This can be used in situations where you believe the spammer is human and may have made a mistake. {username}, {boardTitle}, and {contactUrl} will be replaced with their respective values automatically.

This controls what happens to messages made by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them. Note that if content does not support removal from view, it will be permanently deleted regardless of this setting.

When any of these phrases are entered in a message, the action below will be taken. Enter one phrase per line. You may use a * as a wild card to match any words. If you start the line with /, the line will be treated as a regular expression (example: /test/i).
This controls what happens to threads started by spammers when the spam cleaner is applied against them.
The spam cleaner will only be available to act against users who meet these criteria. If any of these criteria are set to 0 (zero) they will be ignored.
A Steam Web API Key is required for this plugin to function. Terms of the API are here.
Display alternative login bar for Steam

Displays an alternative login bar for Steam that mimics other XenForo login bars. Not recommended by Valve because their official images represent the Steam brand to users. Overrides Steam Login Button option if enabled.
Set user's Steam avatar as forum avatar on registration
Will use the registering user's Steam avatar as their forum avatar. Disabling will give user the default forum avatar.
Display game banners for people in-game if supported. Can cause an extra API request per user in game.
Display Steam Profile in message content (top right)
Display an informational/status block in the message content portion (top right).
Display an informational/status block on messages user information.
Display an informational/status block in profile.
Exclude display of Steam statistics for appids in this list. Comma delimited. Example: 440,550,4000 would exclude stats from Team Fortress 2, Left 4 Dead 2, and Garry's Mod.
While enabled, when Steam User Polling cron runs it'll forcefully update image links for games from the Steam API. Recommended to leave disabled unless you need to update image links.
Polls the Steam Web API for game statistics on a user during registration. Disabling will reduce API requests, however, stats won't exist for the user until the cron runs.
Polls the Steam Web API for game statistics on users. Disabling will reduce API requests.
Controls the source of the images from the Steam CDN. Not all CDN options support HTTPS/SSL. Steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net (HTTPS/HTTP) is recommended, unless you have issues with protocol relative links.
Only display Steam statistics from appids in this list. Comma delimited. Example: 440,550,4000 would only show stats from Team Fortress 2, Left 4 Dead 2, and Garry's Mod.

Controls the source of the API call. If you want to grab JSON over HTTPS instead of HTTP, change to HTTPS only if cURL is enabled and supports HTTPS OR openssl for PHP is installed if cURL is not enabled.
Controls the style of login button on the vistors panel.
Display a navigaton tab for public Steam statistics.
Display Steam login bar on vistor panel
Displays the login bar underneath the "Sign up now!" button.
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their Strava accounts. You can get a client ID via Strava's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your Strava client ID.
Using the Flash uploader allows those visitors with Adobe Flash installed to select multiple files to upload once, and to see a progress meter during the upload.

For performance reasons, you may choose to have the public-facing side of XenForo load its templates from files rather than the database. Note that in order for this to be of benefit, you must have an opcode cache installed on your server (APC, eAccelerator, XCache etc.)
The number of days to maintain template edit history records. Use 0 to never remove history.
This link will be shown in the footer and users will have to agree to the terms and rules during registration.
To allow users to sign in with their Tumblr accounts, you must create a Tumblr application and enter the consumer key.
If you have created a Tumblr application to allow Tumblr sign in, set the application's consumer secret here.

Enabling the Tweet button will allow your visitors to share pages easily using their Twitter account.

You may also specify up to two Twitter accounts to recommend to visitors after they use the Tweet button. More info...
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their Twitch accounts. You can get a client ID via Twitch's Client Applications
The secret that corresponds to your Twitch client ID.
To allow users to sign in with their Twitter accounts, you must create a Twitter application and enter the consumer key and secret.
If you have created a Twitter application to allow Twitter sign in, set the application's consumer secret here.
If you are running a development copy of XenForo and want to develop with the full, uncompressed versions of the XenForo JavaScript files, adjust this setting accordingly.
Update denormalized user names on user name change

When you change a user's user name, you may instruct the system to update all denormalized versions of that user name. This can be an intensive operation, and if you have very large amounts of data you may wish to disable it.
If you enable this option, the links generated by the system will not include "index.php?". However, to enable this, mod_rewrite must be available and an appropriate .htaccess file must be in place.
User change log data will be kept for this many days. Use 0 to keep change log data indefinitely.
The @ character is used to initiate user tagging. If this option is disabled, successful user taggings will remove this character.
The user title ladder will use this field to determine how people move up the ladder.
This controls the minimum and maximum length of user names. Use 0 to disable a limit. User names may never be longer than 50 characters.
Entering a client ID will allow users to login using their Vimeo accounts. You can get a client ID via Vimeo's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your Vimeo client ID.
Entering an app ID will allow users to login using their VK accounts. You can get an app ID via VK's Application Process
The secret that corresponds to your VK App ID. It is located in your Application Settings for this specific domain.
Only send watched content alerts/emails to users active in last X days
If enabled, watched content alerts and emails will only be sent to users that have visited within the specified number of days. This can improve performance on large or very active installations.
Optionally describe the trophy and the criteria the user needs to meet to be awarded it.

The permission tester allows you to view the forum with the permissions of the specified user. You will still be logged in as yourself, but your permissions will show you what is visible for this user.
As this user's permissions will be applied to your account, keep in mind that user-specific permissions will affect you. For example, if the user you're testing as can only edit his/her own posts, you will only be able to edit your own posts.
Note that account changes such as bans will not be reflected by this system. You will not be able to post as this user or see their personal conversations. Also note that systems indirectly tied to the permissions system, such as the selection of thread prefixes, can not be tested with this tool.

Check new registrations against the StopForumSpam database.

StopForumSpam will test the data collected from registering users and attempt to determine if they are a known spammer. Each warning flag that the user generates will be counted. Flags include user name, email and IP address.
You may choose to only count hits against the spam database that have previously been reported a certain number of times.
Only count flags recorded at least this many times
In order to avoid false positives, you may opt to only count hits against the spam database that have been previously recorded within a limited time period.
Only count flags recorded within the last X days
Moderate registrations when this many warning flags are detected
Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be placed in the moderation queue rather than accepted automatically.
Reject registrations when this many warning flags are detected

Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be automatically rejected. This number should be equal to or greater than the value for the moderation threshold above.
Submit spammer information to StopForumSpam using API key

If you have an API key from StopForumSpam, you may have spammer activity on your site automatically reported back to StopForumSpam in order to improve the database for other users. This option will cause users who are banned via the spam cleaner to be reported.

サービスの利用規約とルール

本ウェブサイト（以下、「サービス」）からサービス提供者（以下、「当社」）は、利用者が作成したコンテンツおよびアカウント（以下「コンテンツ」）に対して責任を持ちません。　投稿されたコンテンツは、その著者の意見のみが表明されているものとします。

お客様は本サービスを以下に定めるコンテンツを投稿したり、コンテンツにリンクするために使用しないことを承諾したものとみなします。中傷、侮辱、憎悪、脅迫、スパムまたはスパム的なもの、感情を害するもの、アダルトまたは不快なもの、他人の個人情報を含んでいるもの、著作権侵害の恐れがあるもの、不法行為を助長する可能性のあるもの、もしくは、いずれかの法律に反するもの。

お客様が投稿またはアップロードされた全てのコンテンツは、スタッフメンバーによりレビューされます。お客様が投稿まあはアップロードされた全てのコンテンツは、第３者検証サービス(スパム防止サービスを含むが、これに限定されない)に送付される場合があります。プライベートまたは秘密と見なされるいかなるコンテンツも投稿しないでください。

当社は投稿されたコンテンツを任意の理由で説明なしに削除・修正する権利を留保します。コンテンツの削除・修正要請は、当社の裁量でのみ行われます。当社はサービスの如何なるアカウントについて、いつでも処置する権利を留保します。

当社に対しお客様はコンテンツ使用、公開、再公開するための非独占的かつ恒久的かつ取消不能かつ無制限のライセンスを許諾したものとします。お客様は、コンテンツの著作権を所有します。

本条項は、予告なく何時でも変更される可能性があります。

お客様が本規約を承諾できない場合には、本サービスに登録したり利用しないでください。アカウント閉鎖を希望する場合には、当社までご連絡お願いします。
